title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Agree. The greater number of atoms in compound Z leads to a larger, more polarizable electron cloud than that of compound W. Thus, Z has stronger London dispersion forces and a higher boiling point than W has. (Both compounds have hydrogen bonding.)
